ygData.subject: Re: [EQ_women] Digest Number 108
ygData.msgSnippet: Hi everyone, I play a Paladin as my main character on E ci and just achieved level 50 yesterday.. yay me.. :) But for weapons, I started with 1hs and a shield
ygData.messageBody:
Hi everyone, I play a Paladin as my main character on E'ci and just achieved
level 50 yesterday.. yay me.. :)

But for weapons, I started with 1hs and a shield till around the early teens
when 2hs seemed to deal out more damage. Fine steel is okay, but as soon as
u get some pp, a combine weapon is good for magical creatures.

At higher levels I seem to use my 2hs more than anything else, I have been
frequenting the Plane of Hate to try to get my Dark Metal Holy Water
Sprinkler which happens to be 1hb, and I hadnt used that skill.. So for the
last 10 levels or so I have been summoning my 1hb weapon to try to raise
skill. Its seems odd that one of the best weapons at higher levels is a
blunt, but go figure.

Right now and for the last 5-15 levels I use my ghoulbane and mm shield
(magic resist ) / cracked darkwoodshield (str) in Lower Guk with a FBSS
(haste belt), and Mithral 2h with a +ac belt everywhere else unless fighting
undead. You just cant beat the proc that the ghoulbane dishes out. As soon
as u can get together friends, guildmates, get a ghoulbane, its not too
hard for a level 30ish group.

But as was posted here, we Paladins are very versatile in our weaponry, so
try to keep all 1hs, 1hs and 1hb maxed, I havent seen any 2hb yet, but Im
sure they are out there. grin

So fellow Paladin, Well met and hunt safely


Catt ~~ 50 Paladin of Tunare
Arbiters ~~ E'ci


----- Original Message -----
From: <EQ_women@egroups.com>
To: <EQ_women@egroups.com>
Sent: Thursday, June 15, 2000 2:24 AM
Subject: [EQ_women] Digest Number 108

> Message: 1
> Date: Wed, 14 Jun 2000 07:34:12 -0600
> From: Piqa <LucyBlue@...>
> Subject: Re: Re: New Member
>
> Thanks for your help, Tina. I have been keeping all my skills maxed
except 2h
> blunt... but I'll get that going soon as I find a weapon to use. :) I've
been
> watching how the 2h slash and the 1h slash compare, and it seems the 2h
slash is
> slower, but deals more damage, while the 1h slash is faster, deals less
damage,
> but has the added benefit of the shield to bash. So it's rather a toss up
it
> seems. I've heard that the 2h slash is the paladin's best weapon, so I'll
> probably stick with that and see how it goes. AFter all others are maxed,
of
> course. :)
>
> I think they do still have the weekly market on Mith Marr, but I've never
been.
> Went to N freeport yesterday and wow it was busy.
> Piqa
>
> Christina Norman wrote:
>
> > I'm not a Paladin but I'm good friends with a 53rd level Paladin.
> >
> > Paladins actually have exciting weapons of almost every type. Off hand
I
> > can think of excellent 1h blunt, 2h blunt, 1h slashing, and 2h slashing
> > weapons. Accordingly, I'd suggest trying to train them all to some
> > extent.
> >
> > If you don't want to train them all, I think one handed slashing is
> > probably your most defining weapon type. Paladins are skilled shield
> > bashers. Ghoulbane, a relatively easy to obtain Paladin weapon is one
> > handed slashing.
> >
> > However without an exceptional one handed slashing weapon like
Ghoulbane,
> > most of the time you will benefit from using a two handed slashing
> > weapons. They are more commonly available, and generally do far more
> > damage, then normal one handed slashing weapons. Exceptional one handed
> > slashing weapons are usually paladin only.
> >
> > A good lower-priced two handed slashing weapon is an axe of the iron
> > black. They are easily found Kunark weapons. BBCs are common Antonica
> > 2-handed slashing weapons as are shiny brass halberds, and should be
> > cheaper than an axe. GZs are also good.
> >
> > For one handed slashing, until you obtain ghoulbane, there really aren't
a
> > lot of great one handed slashers. I'd suggest keep your bash and slash
> > maxed with a fine steel longsword and a shield, then switch back to your
> > two-hander once both skills are maxed.
> >
> > Hope this helps =)
> >
> > Tina
>

> Message: 2
> Date: Wed, 14 Jun 2000 09:52:03 -0600 (MDT)
> From: Christina Norman <tina@...>
> Subject: Re: Re: New Member
>
>
> One simple way to measure the effectiveness of a weapon is by its
> damage/delay ratio. For example, a fine steel two handed sword is 12 dmg
> 43 delay for a ratio of 0.28. A fine steel longsword is 6 damage 28 delay
> for a ratio of 0.21. This means you'll do about 30% more damage on
> average with the two handed weapon. Bashing does help to close that
> difference, but my experience has been that it's a small amount of your
> total damage output.
>
> At high levels (50+) it gets much more complicated because the minimum
> damage a weapon can do is based primarily on your level, and not on the
> weapon, which gives an advantage to small fast weapons.
>
> - Christina
>
> On Wed, 14 Jun 2000, Piqa wrote:
> > watching how the 2h slash and the 1h slash compare, and it seems the 2h
slash is
> > slower, but deals more damage, while the 1h slash is faster, deals less
damage,
> > but has the added benefit of the shield to bash. So it's rather a toss
up it
> > seems. I've heard that the 2h slash is the paladin's best weapon, so
I'll
>
>
>

> ________________________________________________________________________

> Message: 3
> Date: Wed, 14 Jun 2000 21:10:31 -0000
> From: "Amy Brau-Goldenburg" <CopperAngel@...>
> Subject: Re: EQ then and now
>
> This thread is kinda old, but...
>
> Judy,
>
> Have you played Asheron's Call. I played it for a little while but
> really hated some of the major gameplay (fighting) interface issues.
> Namely, when you go to loot you have to pick up each item
> individually. As well, there isn't an easy way to target or auto-
> attack. As well, corpse deterioration was VERY (far too) quick and
> people would take your items (limited left on corpse). It is just
> frustrating dealing with scavengers. Finally, their skills system is
> very complex, it offers some nice options, but it is mostly just
> confusing. I have since deleted my account.
>
> However, they had some really nice things that play balance well. In
> particular, the economy seems stable and self-sustaining. Each
> vendor has a base of items and the only "enhanced" items they sell
> have been sold to them by players. I really like the "note" system
> where you pay a little extra money and get a note instead of carrying
> around tons of money. Their trade skills offer experience!!! And
> trades like cooking actually have rewards such as mana or hp gain.
> This unto itself was fantastic for RP value! I believe it is open
> ended leveling. You continue to get experience even off the level 1
> creatures, although it would take you a RL year to level on them
> *grin* but this means there are always things to kill, however
> small. As well, exp is granted based on damage done. Loot rights
> are given to the individual who did the most overall damage. Because
> each person who does damage gets exp, this alleviates KS and
> contention between spawn camping, but sometimes leaves healers at a
> disadvantage. As I mentioned, they have a complex skill system where
> even a warrior can learn to use magic over time. This is nice for
> the really high level folks I imagine. I also like the way equipment
> is handled, but it could be simplified. If you don't have the game,
> check out the ebay auctions because many have pictures of the details
> on the equipment they offer. The rest I have explained, but you may
> wish to check it out yourself for the purposes of market study.
>
> I, too, have noticed so many folks THING oriented. It really got
> nasty for a while on Veeshan with KS and people being generally
> nasty. The server split not long after Kunark came out and things
> have been FAR better there. We used to have an average of 2600
> people online during prime time and now it is down to 1800 or so with
> many more zones to explore.
>
> One thing I have done to keep my interest high is play multiple
> characters. I have several characters in their 20s and none that are
> any higher because I spend time exploring, mastering trade skills or
> generally hanging out with my fantastic guild.
>
> Speaking of... for anyone interested, I am the Guild Elder and
> Assistant Guildmaster of the Storm of Blades Guild on Veeshan. We
> are a small, close-knit guild that values friendship above all else.
> we welcome new members who seek the same values as we do. Please let
> me know if you have interest in joining. I realize that for most it
> would mean starting over, but we will be happy to help out with gear
> and leveling (not necessarily power leveling) if anyone transitioned.
>
>
>
> ________________________________________________________________________
> ________________________________________________________________________
>
>
>
>
